result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonta Lamar Banks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devonta Lamar Banks in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Devonta Lamar Banks.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for Amy Spanczak in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pre-Trial Conference.  Defense has filed a motion to suppress and requests an evidentiary hearing be set.  Court sets 11/14/2022 deadline for State to file its response.  Any reply by the Defense shall be filed 5 days prior to the hearing date.  State to ensure officers are subpoenaed to testify.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Evidentiary hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence, filed.

Defendant Devonta Lamar Banks in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Alexander C. Dyer for Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense filed motion to extend filing deadline and requested crime lab analyst.   Case scheduled for pretrial conference.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Court scheduled deadline for State to turnover crime lab reports by August 31, 2022, and scheduled deadline for defense to file plea forms and any motions by October 12, 2022.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Extend Filing Deadlines.  Received and Filed.  nk
Defense Counsel's Letter to ADA Re: Crime Lab Testing

Defendant Devonta Lamar Banks in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devonta Lamar Banks appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Court in receipt of motion to extend filing deadlines from the defense. Defense has until June 24th, 2022, to file an request for crime lab reports in writing. Defense has until July 13th, 2022, to file any change of plea forms and any motion hearings. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Due to court being in trial, court rescheduled the schedule pre-trial conference hearing from 4:00 pm to 4:30 pm. Court notified the parties via email correspondence.
Received and Filed. Notice of Motion and Motion to Extend Filing Deadlines

Defendant Devonta Lamar Banks in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Court set the following filing date deadlines; May 9th, 2022 for all discovery except for crime lab reports and June 3rd, 2022 for any motions or plea forms. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Devonta Lamar Banks in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland; both appear by video.  Matthew Zisi appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Schlei.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Devonta Lamar Banks in court in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Devonta Lamar Banks in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Devonta Lamar Banks in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devonta Lamar Banks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
